docs.lead_paragraph: The homicide rate among black men from the ages of 15 to 24 rose by two-thirds in the five years through 1988, the Federal Centers for Disease Control said yesterday. In the latest evidence of a continuing increase in violence among young blacks, Dr. Robert Froehlke, the principal author of the report, said more than 95 percent of the increase grew out of a rise in the rate at which these young men were being killed with guns.

headline.main: HOMICIDE RATE UP FOR YOUNG BLACKS

docs.snippet: The homicide rate among black men from the ages of 15 to 24 rose by two-thirds in the five years through 1988, the Federal Centers for Disease Control said yesterday.    In the latest evidence of a continuing increase in violence among young blacks,...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Government will rescind its ban on blood donations by Haitians and, in an effort to make blood transfusions safer, it will require that all blood donors be asked additional questions about their sexual history, Federal officials said today. The policy changes by Secretary of Health and Human Services Louis W. Sullivan are to be announced Wednesday and come after a number of studies by Federal health officials demonstrating the effectiveness of asking more questions. The changes also come after demonstrations protesting the Government's longstanding ban on blood donations by Haitians. Those protests culminated in a march by 50,000 people in New York City last April.

headline.main: U.S. to Alter Screening Of Those Giving Blood

docs.snippet: The Federal Government will rescind its ban on blood donations by Haitians and, in an effort to make blood transfusions safer, it will require that all blood donors be asked additional questions about their sexual history, Federal officials said...

byline.original: By PHILIP J. HILTS, Special to The New York Times
